name: app deploy
description: Deploy your Shopify app.
overviewPreviewDescription: Deploy your Shopify app.

definitions.title: app deploy
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app deploy` command:

appdeploy.name: appdeploy

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: -c, --config <value>
members.description: The name of the app configuration.

members.name: --client-id <value>
members.description: The Client ID of your app.

members.name: --reset
members.description: Reset all your settings.

members.name: -f, --force
members.description: Deploy without asking for confirmation.

members.name: --no-release
members.description: Creates a version but doesn't release it - it's not made available to merchants.

members.name: --message <value>
members.description: Optional message that will be associated with this version. This is for internal use only and won't be available externally.

members.name: --version <value>
members.description: Optional version tag that will be associated with this app version. If not provided, an auto-generated identifier will be generated for this app version.

members.name: --source-control-url <value>
members.description: URL associated with the new app version.

appdeploy.value:
export interface appdeploy {
  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''

  /**
   * The path to your app directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The name of the app configuration.
   */
  '-c, --config <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The Client ID of your app.
   */
  '--client-id <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Reset all your settings.
   */
  '--reset'?: ''

  /**
   * Deploy without asking for confirmation.
   */
  '-f, --force'?: ''

  /**
   * Creates a version but doesn't release it - it's not made available to merchants.
   */
  '--no-release'?: ''

  /**
   * Optional message that will be associated with this version. This is for internal use only and won't be available externally.
   */
  '--message <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Optional version tag that will be associated with this app version. If not provided, an auto-generated identifier will be generated for this app version.
   */
  '--version <value>'?: string

  /**
   * URL associated with the new app version.
   */
  '--source-control-url <value>'?: string
}

name: app dev
description:
[Builds the app](/docs/apps/tools/cli/commands#build) and lets you preview it on a [development store](/docs/apps/tools/development-stores) or [Plus sandbox store](https://help.shopify.com/partners/dashboard/managing-stores/plus-sandbox-store?shpxid=f75d4b9f-3CE2-4156-F28E-0364F1AF6ABB).

  To preview your app on a development store or Plus sandbox store, Shopify CLI walks you through the following steps. If you've run `dev` before, then your settings are saved and some of these steps are skipped. You can reset these configurations using `dev --reset` to go through all of them again:

- Associating your project with an app associated with your Partner account or organization, or creating a new app.
- Selecting a development store or Plus sandbox store to use for testing. If you have only one store, then it's selected automatically.
- Installing your app on the store using the provided install link.
- Creating a tunnel between your local environment and the store using Cloudflare.

  You can use your own tunneling software instead, by passing your tunnel URL with the `--tunnel-url` flag.
- Updating the app URLs that are set in the Partner Dashboard.

  To avoid overwriting any URLs that are already set, select the No, never option. If you select this option, then you're provided with URLs that you can manually add in the Partner Dashboard so you can preview your app.

- Enabling development store preview for extensions.
- Building and serving your app and app extensions.

If you're using the PHP or Ruby app template, then you need to complete the following steps before you can preview your app for the first time:

- PHP: [Set up your Laravel app](https://github.com/Shopify/shopify-app-template-php#setting-up-your-laravel-app)
- Ruby: [Set up your Rails app](https://github.com/Shopify/shopify-app-template-ruby#setting-up-your-rails-app)

> Caution: To use a development store or Plus sandbox store with Shopify CLI, you need to be the store owner, or have a staff account on the store. Staff accounts are created automatically the first time you access a development store with your Partner staff account through the Partner Dashboard.
overviewPreviewDescription: Run the app.

definitions.title: app dev
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `app dev` command:

appdev.name: appdev

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your app directory.

members.name: -c, --config <value>
members.description: The name of the app configuration.

members.name: --client-id <value>
members.description: The Client ID of your app.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. Must be an existing development or Shopify Plus sandbox store.

members.name: --reset
members.description: Reset all your settings.

members.name: --skip-dependencies-installation
members.description: Skips the installation of dependencies. Deprecated, use workspaces instead.

members.name: --no-update
members.description: Skips the Partners Dashboard URL update step.

members.name: --subscription-product-url <value>
members.description: Resource URL for subscription UI extension. Format: "/products/{productId}"

members.name: --checkout-cart-url <value>
members.description: Resource URL for checkout UI extension. Format: "/cart/{productVariantID}:{productQuantity}"

members.name: --tunnel-url <value>
members.description: Use a custom tunnel, it must be running before executing dev. Format: "https://my-tunnel-url:port".

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the theme app extension host theme.

members.name: --theme-app-extension-port <value>
members.description: Local port of the theme app extension development server.

members.name: --notify <value>
members.description: The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.

appdev.value:
export interface appdev {
  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''

  /**
   * The path to your app directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The name of the app configuration.
   */
  '-c, --config <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The Client ID of your app.
   */
  '--client-id <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. Must be an existing development or Shopify Plus sandbox store.
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Reset all your settings.
   */
  '--reset'?: ''

  /**
   * Skips the installation of dependencies. Deprecated, use workspaces instead.
   */
  '--skip-dependencies-installation'?: ''

  /**
   * Skips the Partners Dashboard URL update step.
   */
  '--no-update'?: ''

  /**
   * Resource URL for subscription UI extension. Format: "/products/{productId}"
   */
  '--subscription-product-url <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Resource URL for checkout UI extension. Format: "/cart/{productVariantID}:{productQuantity}"
   */
  '--checkout-cart-url <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Use a custom tunnel, it must be running before executing dev. Format: "https://my-tunnel-url:port".
   */
  '--tunnel-url <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the theme app extension host theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Local port of the theme app extension development server.
   */
  '--theme-app-extension-port <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.
   */
  '--notify <value>'?: string
}

definitions.title: commands
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `commands` command:

commands.name: commands

members.name: --json
members.description: Format output as json.

members.name: -h, --help
members.description: Show CLI help.

members.name: --hidden
members.description: show hidden commands

members.name: --tree
members.description: show tree of commands

members.name: --columns <value>
members.description: only show provided columns (comma-separated)

members.name: --sort <value>
members.description: property to sort by (prepend '-' for descending)

members.name: --filter <value>
members.description: filter property by partial string matching, ex: name=foo

members.name: --csv
members.description: output is csv format [alias: --output=csv]

members.name: --output <value>
members.description: output in a more machine friendly format

members.name: -x, --extended
members.description: show extra columns

members.name: --no-truncate
members.description: do not truncate output to fit screen

members.name: --no-header
members.description: hide table header from output

commands.value:
export interface commands {
  /**
   * Format output as json.
   */
  '--json'?: ''

  /**
   * Show CLI help.
   */
  '-h, --help'?: ''

  /**
   * show hidden commands
   */
  '--hidden'?: ''

  /**
   * show tree of commands
   */
  '--tree'?: ''

  /**
   * only show provided columns (comma-separated)
   */
  '--columns <value>'?: string

  /**
   * property to sort by (prepend '-' for descending)
   */
  '--sort <value>'?: string

  /**
   * filter property by partial string matching, ex: name=foo
   */
  '--filter <value>'?: string

  /**
   * output is csv format [alias: --output=csv]
   */
  '--csv'?: ''

  /**
   * output in a more machine friendly format
   */
  '--output <value>'?: string

  /**
   * show extra columns
   */
  '-x, --extended'?: ''

  /**
   * do not truncate output to fit screen
   */
  '--no-truncate'?: ''

  /**
   * hide table header from output
   */
  '--no-header'?: ''
}

definitions.title: theme check
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme check` command:

themecheck.name: themecheck

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

members.name: --dev-preview
members.description: Use the dev preview version of theme check Applies the typescript implementation of theme check to the theme

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: -a, --auto-correct
members.description: Automatically fix offenses

members.name: -c, --category <value>
members.description: Only run this category of checks Runs checks matching all categories when specified more than once

members.name: -C, --config <value>
members.description: Use the config provided, overriding .theme-check.yml if present  Supports all theme-check: config values, e.g., theme-check:theme-app-extension,  theme-check:recommended, theme-check:all  For backwards compatibility, :theme_app_extension is also supported

members.name: -x, --exclude-category <value>
members.description: Exclude this category of checks Excludes checks matching any category when specified more than once

members.name: --fail-level <value>
members.description: Minimum severity for exit with error code

members.name: --update-docs
members.description: Update Theme Check docs (objects, filters, and tags)

members.name: --init
members.description: Generate a .theme-check.yml file

members.name: --list
members.description: List enabled checks

members.name: -o, --output <value>
members.description: The output format to use

members.name: --print
members.description: Output active config to STDOUT

members.name: -v, --version
members.description: Print Theme Check version

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

themecheck.value:
export interface themecheck {
  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''

  /**
   * Use the dev preview version of theme check
Applies the typescript implementation of theme check to the theme
   */
  '--dev-preview'?: ''

  /**
   * The path to your theme directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Automatically fix offenses
   */
  '-a, --auto-correct'?: ''

  /**
   * Only run this category of checks
Runs checks matching all categories when specified more than once
   */
  '-c, --category <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Use the config provided, overriding .theme-check.yml if present
      Supports all theme-check: config values, e.g., theme-check:theme-app-extension,
      theme-check:recommended, theme-check:all
      For backwards compatibility, :theme_app_extension is also supported 
   */
  '-C, --config <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Exclude this category of checks
Excludes checks matching any category when specified more than once
   */
  '-x, --exclude-category <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Minimum severity for exit with error code
   */
  '--fail-level <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Update Theme Check docs (objects, filters, and tags)
   */
  '--update-docs'?: ''

  /**
   * Generate a .theme-check.yml file
   */
  '--init'?: ''

  /**
   * List enabled checks
   */
  '--list'?: ''

  /**
   * The output format to use
   */
  '-o, --output <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Output active config to STDOUT
   */
  '--print'?: ''

  /**
   * Print Theme Check version
   */
  '-v, --version'?: ''

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string
}

export interface themedelete {
  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.

  /**

   * Delete your development theme.

  /**
   * Include others development themes in theme list.
   */

  /**
   * Skip confirmation.
   */

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */

  /**

}

name: theme dev
description: Uploads the current theme as a development theme to the connected store, then prints theme editor and preview URLs to your terminal. While running, changes will push to the store in real time.
overviewPreviewDescription: Uploads the current theme as a development theme to the connected store, then prints theme editor and preview URLs to your terminal. While running, changes will push to the store in real time.

definitions.title: theme dev
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `theme dev` command:

themedev.name: themedev

members.name: --no-color
members.description: Disable color output.

members.name: --verbose
members.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

members.name: --path <value>
members.description: The path to your theme directory.

members.name: --host <value>
members.description: Set which network interface the web server listens on. The default value is 127.0.0.1.

members.name: --live-reload <value>
members.description: The live reload mode switches the server behavior when a file is modified: - hot-reload Hot reloads local changes to CSS and sections (default) - full-page  Always refreshes the entire page - off        Deactivate live reload

members.name: --poll
members.description: Force polling to detect file changes.

members.name: --theme-editor-sync
members.description: Synchronize Theme Editor updates in the local theme files.

members.name: --port <value>
members.description: Local port to serve theme preview from.

members.name: -s, --store <value>
members.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

members.name: -t, --theme <value>
members.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

members.name: -n, --nodelete
members.description: Runs the dev command without deleting local files.

members.name: -o, --only <value>
members.description: Hot reload only files that match the specified pattern.

members.name: -x, --ignore <value>
members.description: Skip hot reloading any files that match the specified pattern.

members.name: --password <value>
members.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

members.name: -e, --environment <value>
members.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

members.name: --notify <value>
members.description: The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.

members.name: --open
members.description: Automatically launch the theme preview in your default web browser.

themedev.value:
export interface themedev {
  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''

  /**
   * The path to your theme directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Set which network interface the web server listens on. The default value is 127.0.0.1.
   */
  '--host <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The live reload mode switches the server behavior when a file is modified:
- hot-reload Hot reloads local changes to CSS and sections (default)
- full-page  Always refreshes the entire page
- off        Deactivate live reload
   */
  '--live-reload <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Force polling to detect file changes.
   */
  '--poll'?: ''

  /**
   * Synchronize Theme Editor updates in the local theme files.
   */
  '--theme-editor-sync'?: ''

  /**
   * Local port to serve theme preview from.
   */
  '--port <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Runs the dev command without deleting local files.
   */
  '-n, --nodelete'?: ''

  /**
   * Hot reload only files that match the specified pattern.
   */
  '-o, --only <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Skip hot reloading any files that match the specified pattern.
   */
  '-x, --ignore <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.
   */
  '--notify <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Automatically launch the theme preview in your default web browser.
   */
  '--open'?: ''
}

themepush.value:
export interface themepush {
  /**
   * Disable color output.
   */
  '--no-color'?: ''

  /**
   * Increase the verbosity of the logs.
   */
  '--verbose'?: ''

  /**
   * The path to your theme directory.
   */
  '--path <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Password generated from the Theme Access app.
   */
  '--password <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).
   */
  '-s, --store <value>'?: string

  /**
   * The environment to apply to the current command.
   */
  '-e, --environment <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Theme ID or name of the remote theme.
   */
  '-t, --theme <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Push theme files from your remote development theme.
   */
  '-d, --development'?: ''

  /**
   * Push theme files from your remote live theme.
   */
  '-l, --live'?: ''

  /**
   * Create a new unpublished theme and push to it.
   */
  '-u, --unpublished'?: ''

  /**
   * Runs the push command without deleting local files.
   */
  '-n, --nodelete'?: ''

  /**
   * Download only the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).
   */
  '-o, --only <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Skip downloading the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).
   */
  '-x, --ignore <value>'?: string

  /**
   * Output JSON instead of a UI.
   */
  '-j, --json'?: ''

  /**
   * Allow push to a live theme.
   */
  '-a, --allow-live'?: ''

  /**
   * Publish as the live theme after uploading.
   */
  '-p, --publish'?: ''
}

description:
Triggers the delivery of a sample Admin API event topic payload to a designated address.

  You should use this command to experiment with webhooks, to initially test your webhook configuration, or for unit testing. However, to test your webhook configuration from end to end, you should always trigger webhooks by performing the related action in Shopify.

  Because most webhook deliveries use remote endpoints, you can trigger the command from any directory where you can use Shopify CLI, and send the webhook to any of the supported endpoint types. For example, you can run the command from your app's local directory, but send the webhook to a staging environment endpoint.

  To learn more about using webhooks in a Shopify app, refer to [Webhooks overview](https://shopify.dev/docs/apps/webhooks).

  ### Limitations

  - Webhooks triggered using this method always have the same payload, so they can't be used to test scenarios that differ based on the payload contents.
  - Webhooks triggered using this method aren't retried when they fail.
  - Trigger requests are rate-limited using the Partner API rate limit.
  - You can't use this method to validate your API webhook subscriptions.
overviewPreviewDescription: Trigger delivery of a sample webhook topic payload to a designated address.

definitions.title: webhook trigger
definitions.description: The following flags are available for the `webhook trigger` command:

webhooktrigger.name: webhooktrigger

members.name: --help
members.description: This help. When you run the trigger command the CLI will prompt you for any information that isn't passed using flags.

members.name: --topic <value>
members.description: The requested webhook topic.

members.name: --api-version <value>
members.description: The API Version of the webhook topic.

members.name: --delivery-method <value>
members.description: Method chosen to deliver the topic payload. If not passed, it's inferred from the address.

members.name: --shared-secret <value>
members.description: Deprecated. Please use client-secret.

members.name: --client-secret <value>
members.description: Your app's client secret. This secret allows us to return the X-Shopify-Hmac-SHA256 header that lets you validate the origin of the response that you receive.

members.name: --address <value>
members.description: The URL where the webhook payload should be sent.                You will need a different address type for each delivery-method:                       For remote HTTP testing, use a URL that starts with https://   For local HTTP testing, use http://localhost:{port}/{url-path}                       For Google Pub/Sub, use pubsub://{project-id}:{topic-id}                       For Amazon EventBridge, use an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) starting with arn:aws:events:
